chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Remington M. Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:18 am 
INCLUDES 20CM32, 20CM1582, 21CF1263, 22CF204, & 22CF624. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Tom Roley.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 20CM1582: Cts. 1-3>>D&RI. 
In 21CF1263: Ct. 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF204: Cts. 3 & 4>>D&RI. 
In 22CF624: Cts. 1-7>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 20CM32: Ct. 1 (Resisting an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 21CF1263: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 22CF204: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (Drive or Operate Vehicle w/out Consent/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS:
In 20CM32: Ct. 1>>SWH for 1 yr probation. 
In 21CF1263: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
                     : Ct. 2>>SWH for 1 yr probation. 
In 22CF204: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation - ADDITIONAL CONDITION: 9 months MCJ with 109 days credit. 
                   : Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS on ALL>>Alcohol assessment if deemed appropriate by agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no contact with DJA, TVA, and DAM; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 

COURT finds the def entitled to credit if revoked as follows: 
In 20CM32>>2 days credit. 
In 21CF1263>>39 days credit. 

Adj: 11:34 am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
